author: Sky TG24
title: Usa, onde gigantesche in California: aree evacuate | Sky TG24
text: Onde anche di sei metri stanno flagellando da ore la costa californiana, provocando allagamenti e distruzione di strutture balneari. La tempesta ha messo in fuga molte persone che si godevano gli ultimi giorni dell'anno con passeggiate lungo le spiagge - Le coste della California sono flagellate da ieri da onde alte fino a sei metri che stanno provocando danni e allagamenti soprattutto alle strutture balneari [Onu: “12mila disastri meteo e 2 milioni di vittime in 50 anni”](https://tg24.sky.it/ambiente/2023/05/22/meteo-cambiamento-climatico-eventi-vittime-onu) [](#02) - Diverse le persone messe in fuga dall'aggravarsi della situazione, soprattutto i vacanzieri che si godevano gli ultimi giorni dell’anno a passeggiare lungo le spiagge [Disastri naturali in Italia: 35 miliardi di danni in 10 anni](https://tg24.sky.it/ambiente/2023/10/20/cambiamento-climatico-italia-danni-costo) [](#03) - Le prime anomalie si sono registrate ieri lungo Ventura Beach, una delle mete più popolate in questi giorni, tra Los Angeles e Santa Barbara [Film apocalittici sui disastri naturali: quali vedere](https://tg24.sky.it/spettacolo/cinema/approfondimenti/film-apocalittici) [](#04) - Muri sono stati abbattuti nel sud della California. Una ventina di persone sono state colte di sorpresa dalle onde, otto sono state ricoverate in ospedale per ferite [](#06) - Alcune aree vicine all'oceano sono state evacuate. Le immagini delle onde gigantesche sono diventate virali sui social [Terremoti, scossa di magnitudo 4.8 a confine tra California e Messico](https://tg24.sky.it/mondo/2023/12/01/terremoto-california-oggi)

author: world today news
title: The Red Cross-Edomex prepares vaccines against Covid-19
text:
President of the Board of Directors of the Red Cross in the State of Mexico , Mario Vázquez Torres has announced that the worthy institution will try to get vaccines against Covid-19, to offer the biological at a more affordable price than what pharmacies have.
In a message within the framework of the start of the vaccination campaign for the cold season, he pointed out that the intention the Pfizer vaccine and being able to give it to the population despite the dangers of the winter season.
He remembered that the Red Cross of the State of Mexico offered the antigen to the population against SAR-Cov-2 and explained that the cost of the vaccine for the population last year was 900 pesos and the batch received by the institution in Toluca was doses 1,600.
We recommend: 70% of children in the State of Mexico are victims of violence
Without specifying at the moment how much those interested in applying the vaccine will have to pay, he said that this year it is expected to be the same as 2023 or if a little more is possible, the better.
“The aim is to have access to the vaccine for those who need it, especially as we know that prevention is essential this season, and we want to support by offering a price more affordable than in commercial pharmacies.” said Mario Vázquez Torres.
He pointed out that the sensitive spirit that characterizes the Red Cross will again be on the issue of vaccines, since the price offered to the interested population is lower than those regulated by commercial pharmacies.
You can read: Itinerant Save Lives models start in the Metro
He said that if the process to obtain vaccines against Covid-19 is strengthened again and the Red Cross is able to provide the biological, he suggested that the people who received the Pfizer dose will come forward with it that the antigen must be obtained annually.
In April this year, at state level, the Red Cross received the vaccine and a care scheme was proposed for 40 vulnerable communities in the Mexican cities of Lerma and Huixquilucan, with priority for the elderly population than 65 years, with some degree. of isolation.
Follow us on Facebook: The Official Press and on Twitter: @laprensaoem
2024-10-17 19:10:00
#Red #CrossEdomex #prepares #vaccines #Covid19

author: @WBRCnews
title: Magic Moments surprises Christian Savage with an all-expense-paid trip to Disney
text:
BIRMINGHAM, Ala. ( WBRC ) - Magic Moments of Alabama surprised 17-year-old Christian Savage and his family with an all-expense-paid trip to Disney.
Christian Savage, who was 15 years old at the time, was playing video games in June 2022 when gunfire ripped through his family’s apartment.
Savage was given a 10% chance to survive. But after more than 100 days at Children’s of Alabama, he’s made a miraculous recovery and returned to school last fall.
Following the incident, the family moved to an apartment to be in the Wenonah school district. Their apartment was robbed while Savage was in the hospital.
He still suffers some paralysis but has come a long way.
On Feb. 28, Magic of Moments paid Savage a visit at Wenonah High School to surprise Savage with a trip of a lifetime. The organization will fully fund a magical trip to Walt Disney World in Lake Buena Vista, Florida for Savage and his family.
Savage was all smiles during the surprise in front of his classmates. It was a heartwarming morning and moment for all.
WBRC LATEST VIDEO Get news alerts in the Apple App Store and Google Play Store or subscribe to our email newsletter here .
Copyright 2024 WBRC. All rights reserved.

author: Jewish Link Staff
title: MTA Teaches AI Lessons to Talmidim
text:
At Yeshiva University High School for Boys, the 11th-grade students are learning how to ethically incorporate artificial intelligence into their academic work. Rather than shying away from AI, the school is preparing its students to navigate and utilize emerging technologies in a responsible manner.
For a recent history assignment, students first wrote a Document-Based Question (DBQ) essay, then input their original work into ChatGPT to ask for suggestions on improving grammar, chronology and flow. This exercise not only helped students refine their writing but also introduced them to the practical applications of AI in academic settings. The goal is to equip students with the skills to use AI ethically and effectively in the real world, where such technologies are becoming increasingly prevalent.
The students were also taught how to properly cite ChatGPT as a source, a skill that is introduced during freshman year English, reinforcing the importance of academic integrity in an age of rapidly advancing technology. By learning how to credit AI for its assistance, they gained an understanding of how to balance innovation with responsibility.
After receiving AI-generated revisions, the students compared their original essays with the improved versions, reflecting on what they liked best about both their own work and the bot’s suggestions. This critical evaluation not only honed their writing skills but also deepened their understanding of AI’s role in enhancing, rather than replacing, their efforts. In the final step of the project, the students rewrote their essays, incorporating the changes they found most helpful from the AI’s suggestions. This allowed them to merge their own ideas with the improvements offered by ChatGPT, resulting in a more polished final draft. Through this exercise,
Yeshiva University High School for Boys is fostering a thoughtful and responsible approach to AI, preparing students to use these tools ethically as they enter a world where technology and artificial intelligence are integral to many fields. The school’s focus is not on avoiding AI but on ensuring students are equipped with the knowledge and skills to use it in ways that align with academic integrity and real-world applications.

organizations.name: Yeshiva University High School for Boys

author: Alondra Rodríguez
title: Aleyda Ortiz rompe el silencio y revela el momento más oscuro de su paso por Univision
text:
Aleyda Ortiz rompe el silencio y revela el momento más oscuro de su paso por Univision
Publicado el 16/07/2025 a las 20:48
- Aleyda Ortiz rompe el silencio
- Críticas a trato en Univision
- Aprendió a darse respeto
Aleyda Ortiz abrió su corazón y compartió uno de los momentos más difíciles de su carrera televisiva al recordar su salida de Univision, donde aseguró que tuvo que aprender a imponerse y hacerse respetar.
En una entrevista reciente con su amiga Clarissa Molina para su canal de YouTube, la presentadora puertorriqueña habló con franqueza sobre los episodios que marcaron su decisión de cerrar ese ciclo profesional.
Ortiz, ganadora de la octava temporada de Nuestra Belleza Latina, relató cómo en 2022 decidió marcharse de la cadena tras sentir que no recibía las oportunidades que buscaba.
“Dije: ‘Quiero más, esto no puede ser. Voy en busca de nuevas oportunidades’”, recordó la conductora, quien actualmente trabaja para Telemundo en el programa “En casa con Telemundo”.
El momento más oscuro en su carrera
Durante la conversación con Molina, Aleyda rememoró lo que calificó como su “momento más oscuro” dentro de Univision, ocurrido durante una grabación de Nuestra Belleza Latina.
“Estábamos grabando algo para Nuestra Belleza Latina. Era algo bien bonito, algo que yo quería hacer bien. A Clari le dio covid y no pudo llegar”, comenzó relatando Ortiz sobre aquel episodio.
[TE PUEDE INTERESAR: Raúl de Molina conmueve con emotivo mensaje a inmigrantes en su regreso a ‘El gordo y la flaca’]
Aleyda explicó que la producción la convocó sin brindarle apoyo básico para la grabación, algo que la dejó completamente frustrada.
“La cosa fue que a mí me hicieron un llamado y me dijeron: ‘Mira Aleyda para que seas parte, pero no hay nada, no hay ropa, no hay maquillaje, tú haz todo’”, compartió la animadora.
Frustración y decisión de cambio
En su relato describió con honestidad la sensación de impotencia que la llevó incluso a romper en llanto al llegar a su casa esa noche.
“Y yo muy frustrada porque 1 yo no estaba haciendo en ese momento ningún programa que a mí me diera ropa ni nada, todo lo hacía yo; 2 no tenía una posición bien en la empresa, so me sentí bien frustrada porque era como: ‘Caray, estamos aquí todas dispuestas pero como que no hacen las cosas bien’”, confesó.
Aleyda contó que tras esa noche difícil tomó la determinación de no permitir que decisiones ajenas afectaran su bienestar.
“Me acuerdo que me acosté llorando. Esa noche fue terrible. Ese día me acuerdo que me hice una promesa de que no me podían afectar tanto las decisiones porque quizás nada tienen que ver conmigo”, reflexionó con sinceridad.
Aprendizaje y respeto personal
Ese momento crítico, relató, la obligó a aprender a poner límites claros y a valorarse más como profesional.
“Fue lo que me ayudó en ese momento a ser firme y darme a respetar. Y me tuve que dar a respetar y aprendí a darme a respetar. Y se sintió bien”, expresó con orgullo.
La presentadora también explicó las circunstancias que rodearon su salida definitiva de Univision, tras no recibir una propuesta formal de renovación.
“Lo que a mí me pasó fue que se me acaba el contrato y yo le digo: ‘Dame una oferta nueva’. Y no tenían una oferta nueva para mí”, reveló Ortiz sobre esas negociaciones fallidas.
Carisma y profesionalismo
En su testimonio expuso la confusión y el malestar que le generó el manejo de su situación por parte de la empresa.
“Entonces trataron de como que no, que sí. No. Nunca me llegó una fecha de aquí está en papel. Esa manipulación, esa frustración a mí no me gustó”, dijo con franqueza.
Actualmente, Aleyda Ortiz cuenta con más de medio millón de seguidores en Instagram y se ha consolidado como una figura reconocida en la televisión hispana en Estados Unidos.
Hoy disfruta de una nueva etapa como presentadora en Telemundo, donde continúa compartiendo su carisma y profesionalismo con la audiencia.
Nuevo inicio en Telemundo
Su testimonio ha resonado entre colegas y seguidores que valoran su decisión de hablar con honestidad sobre los retos en la industria.
Ortiz enfatizó la importancia de reconocer el propio valor y aprender a exigir respeto en cualquier ámbito laboral, especialmente para quienes trabajan en los medios.
Con estas revelaciones, la ex reina de belleza busca inspirar a otros a mantenerse firmes y no ceder ante circunstancias que comprometan su dignidad profesional, señaló ‘People en Español‘.

author: Aleja Hertzler-McCain
title: Texas attorney general moves to shut down Catholic migrant shelters
text:
Texas attorney general moves to shut down Catholic migrant shelters
Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton has
sued a volunteer-run network of Catholic migrant shelters based in El Paso, Texas, aiming to revoke the organization’s nonprofit registration. The lawsuit comes after Annunciation House moved to delay handing over documents about its clients to the attorney general.
Paxton’s office said it had demanded Annunciation House records because of the organization’s “potential efforts to facilitate illegal immigration.”
“The Office of the Attorney General (‘OAG’) reviewed significant public record information strongly suggesting Annunciation House is engaged in legal violations such as facilitating illegal entry to the United States, alien harboring, human smuggling, and operating a stash house,” the office wrote in a
press release on February 20.
If Paxton, a Republican, is successful, Annunciation House, which was founded in 1976, could be required to cease sheltering migrants entering Texas. The lawsuit “seeks to revoke Annunciation House’s authorization to do business in Texas and asks the court to appoint a receiver to liquidate their assets,” Paxton’s office wrote.
On its
 website, Annunciation House says it has hosted more than 500,000 migrants fleeing death squads, civil wars, human rights abuses, and poverty.
“The Attorney General’s illegal, immoral and anti-faith position to shut down Annunciation House is unfounded,” Annunciation House said in its own
https://annunciationhouse.org/press-release/. Paxton’s office “has stated that it considers it a crime for a Catholic organization to provide shelter to refugees,” the organization said.
According to reporting from
the Texas Tribune, the attorney general’s administrative subpoena sent to Annunciation House demanded it turn over records from January 2022 onward that included identifying information about Annunciation House’s clients, referrals the nonprofit had made to legal services, and their applications for federal funding for organizations that address hunger and homelessness.
Annunciation House said the attorney general told the nonprofit on February 7 that it had a day to turn over records. After the state denied Annunciation House an extension, the organization responded by requesting that a US district court rule on what documents it was required to turn over, and that it receive a restraining order granting more time to comply with Paxton’s demands.’
The statement from Paxton’s office described the attempt to shut down Annunciation House as a “consequence” of the organization’s legal actions and delays.
Paxton’s legal action appears to be part of a broader Republican push to target Catholic nonprofits serving migrants at the border amid an effort to make immigration a key 2024 election campaign issue.
In December 2022, four House Republicans, including two from Texas, sent a
letter to Catholic Charities USA, a network of diocesan charity organizations, accusing it of “fueling” illegal immigration and violating federal law by providing necessities to migrants.
That same month, Texas Gov. Greg Abbott, a Catholic,
called on Paxton to investigate El Paso nonprofits because they “may have assisted with illegal border crossings near El Paso.”
Since then, Texas has escalated its anti-migrant actions. In January its National Guard got into a standoff with federal agents in Eagle Pass, Texas, after guard members and state troopers
blocked the agents’ access to the US border. The same month, the US Supreme Court ordered Texas to remove concertina wire from along the river erected to stop migrants from crossing.
Paxton often participates in legal action through the Republican Attorneys General Association, a group that has
received millions in donations from the Concord Fund, which is linked to conservative Catholic legal activist Leonard Leo. —Religion News Service

author: macamilarincon
title: Venezuela anuncia ejercicio militar y acusa al Reino Unido de "provocación hostil" por buque en las costas de Guyana
text: [Venezuela](https://cnnespanol.cnn.com/category/zona-andina/venezuela/) Venezuela anuncia ejercicio militar y acusa al Reino Unido de "provocación hostil" por buque en las costas de Guyana (CNN Español) –– El presidente de Venezuela, Nicolás Maduro, anunció este jueves que ordenó una acción conjunta defensiva en respuesta a lo que señaló como una "provocación del Reino Unido" luego de que inicialmente la BBC reportara, citando al Ministerio de Defensa británico, que se enviaría un buque patrullero a las costas de Guyana. "Por eso he ordenado la activación de una acción conjunta de toda la fuerza armada nacional militar bolivariana sobre el caribe oriental de Venezuela, sobre la fachada atlántica, una acción conjunta de carácter defensiva como respuesta a la provocación y a la amenaza del Reino Unido contra la paz y la soberanía de nuestro país", afirmó Maduro durante la ceremonia de salutación de fin de año a la Fuerza Armada Nacional Bolivariana (FANB). La reacción de Venezuela sigue a un reporte de la BBC del domingo en el que indicaba, citando al Ministerio de Defensa, que el Reino Unido se preparaba para "enviar un buque de guerra a Guyana en una muestra de apoyo diplomático y militar a la antigua colonia británica". [¿Qué sigue ahora en la disputa entre Venezuela y Guyana por el Esequibo? Puntos claves del acuerdo y posibles escenarios](https://cnnespanol.cnn.com/2023/12/16/esequibo-disputa-venezuela-guyana-acuerdo-posibles-escenarios-orix/) El HMS Trent, un patrullero de la Marina británica, agregó la BBC, visitará Guyana, "aliado regional y socio de la Commonwealth, a finales de este mes como parte de una serie de compromisos en la región durante su despliegue de tareas de patrulla en el Atlántico". El Ministerio de Defensa del Reino Unido confirmó a CNN en Londres esta declaración. Maduró calificó a la respuesta venezolana como “acción conjunta militar general Domingo Sifonte” en honor al general que Maduro considera héroe de la Guyana Esequiba y a quien, además, se le rendirá homenaje en enero "trayendo sus restos a que descanse definitivamente en el panteón de los héroes de Venezuela". La Cancillería de Venezuela publicó un comunicado en rechazo a la llegada del buque británico y advirtió a la Comunidad del Caribe (Caricom) y a la Comunidad de Estados Latinoamericanos y Caribeños (Celac) de que las acciones contradicen el entendimiento acordado el 14 de diciembre entre Venezuela y Guyana. “La presencia de la nave militar es extremadamente grave, ya que viene acompañada de declaraciones por parte de voceros políticos y militares de quien fungió como despojador de la Guyana Esequiba, el cual insiste en inmiscuirse en dicha controversia”, dice el comunicado. El encuentro que se llevó a cabo el 14 de diciembre entre los mandatarios de Guyana y Venezuela en San Vicente y las Granadinas cerró con el compromiso de mantener la vía diplomática como el único camino para resolver el conflicto, y se estableció el acuerdo de 11 puntos suscrito por las partes y los mediadores de ambos países. "Venezuela insta a las autoridades guyanesas a tomar medidas inmediatas para el retiro del buque HMS Trent, y abstenerse de seguir involucrando a potencias militares en la controversia territorial", afirma el comunicado. CNN está intentando comunicarse con el Ministerio de Defensa del Reino Unido por los informes de que personal militar venezolano participará en ejercicios militares en el golfo de Paria en respuesta al despliegue del HMS Trent en Guyana. Osmary Hernández colaboró con este reporte.

author: Stabroek News
title: Many families were denied the season’s pleasantries
text:
Dear Editor,
Where it all began, Christmas was cancelled this year in Bethlehem, the biblical birth place of Jesus, the bubbling place where traditionally, the world would visit at this time of the year. Earlier, The Washington Post reported, “The atmosphere in Bethlehem on the eve of Christmas this year is somber, dark, sad — and political.” The article stated, “This year there will be no tree. No parades, bands or music. No lights. No markets, no feasts, no carols. No Santas handing out candy to the children. And no pilgrims. No tourists.” Rami Asakrieh, a Franciscan friar, is pastor of St. Catherine’s Church, where midnight Mass is usually celebrated said, “It’s impossible to celebrate when so many — on both sides — have lost so much. We canceled the festivities as a sign of solidarity with the victims of the war.”
The message of peace and goodwill unto mankind for Christmas meant nothing as the number of casualties continue to escalate in war-torn areas, namely, Russia/Ukraine and Israel/Gaza. For Christians, Israel (the Promised Land) is the “Holy Land,” because it is the place where Jesus’ life and death unfolded. And, for Muslims, Jerusalem is the place where the Prophet Muhammad ascended to heaven. Guyana also came close to the brink of cancelling Christmas this year as fear gripped the nation from a threatening annexation of Essequibo from Venezuela. Guyanese are lucky to have escaped the perils of a potential war from their neighbour. Guyanese are thankful for the peace talk earlier this month in SVG. The dialogue initiated by Brazil’s President and the Prime Minister of St. Vincent and the Grenadines, provided the framework and the forum (Argyle Agreement) to prevent any military aggression from both countries, thus avoiding the probability of possible casualties. This “truce” allowed the Latin America/South America/Carib-bean to remain a peace zone for Christmas and going forward, hopefully.
The BBC reported at least 20,915 people have been killed and 54,918 wounded in Israeli attacks since October 7. The revised death toll from Hamas’s attack on Israel stands at 1,139, 695 Israeli civilians (including 36 children), 71 foreign nationals, and 373 security forces. The Hamas-Run Health Ministry and Government Media Office reported that “more than 8,000 children and 6,200 women had been killed. It also said that 310 medical personnel, 35 civil defense personnel and 97 journalists had been killed – all of them civilians.” According to the United Nation’s child agency, UNICEF, “Gaza is now the most dangerous place in the world to be a child.” Almost all of Palestine’s 2.3 million population have been displaced and a large part of Gaza has been devastated. According to the Israel media reports, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says, “war will not stop,” and he is ready to encourage Palestinians in Gaza to leave the enclave. Hamas has condemned the statement.
The New York Times and CNN reported over 500,000 casualties have been accounted for since the Russia/ Ukraine war began. Some 120,000 deaths are Russians with 180,000 injured troops while 70,000 are Ukraine killed with 120,000 wounded. Some 23,000 innocent civilians were caught up in the war and are reported missing or dead. The Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) verified a total of 9,614 civilian deaths during Russia’s invasion of Ukraine as of September, 2023. Furthermore, 17,535 people were reported to have been injured. Foreigners account for almost 100. According to International News Safety Institute (INSI), 17 journalists died in the line of duty. Even the United Nations was not spared with 136 staff members killed. Evelyn Farkas, a former top Pentagon official for Ukraine who is now the executive director of the McCain Institute said, “These are people. Ukraine is a democracy, so the loss of lives could have greater political impact. But even in an autocracy, Vladimir Putin knows that public sentiment can make a difference.”
Back in our jolly land of Guyana where mirth and merriment merged to manifest a happy Christmas for most of us, the moment was mired by mayhem on our roads and in the homes. Many families were denied the season’s pleasantries as their dear ones were taken away from them. It wasn’t an attack on democracy or the old Parliament Building, but the building did suffer a blow when a truck rammed into the fence last Thursday. Did this provide a sign as to what was to follow? The famous attorney, Mr. Rex McKay passed away. The very day, there was a head on collision in Essequibo which resulted in a fatality. In Port Kaituma, a 13-year-old girl allegedly drowned after falling off a boat. Friday brought some smiles as it was the last working day for most people before the holidays. The President also made history at Leonora when he cut the ribbon for the opening of the first bank in his home village. Demerara Bank opened its door for customers.
On Saturday, fire ravaged a building in Sophia, leaving 7 people homeless, damaging 3 vehicles, injuring 2 and scorching 2 other buildings. The Eve of Christmas, Sunday, provided much soured excitement. In North Rupununi, a pedestrian was struck by a car in an accident. Another pedestrian was not as lucky as he was killed by a truck reversing at Windsor Forest, West Coast Demerara. A man was shot dead during an attempted robbery in Campbeville. A husband was killed in a shooting incident by his reputed wife’s lover at Diamond, East Bank Demerara. Christmas Day was spoiled with the death of two friends involved in a speeding car accident at Le Destin, East Bank Esse-quibo and with another injured. The devastating fire at Linden killed 3 family members. Boxing Day saw I person injured during a robbery at a Chinese supermarket in Herstelling. As the wars continue abroad with no sign of coming to an end in sight, many more will not see the beginning of the New Year. Can Guyanese prevent the occurrence of the Christmas tragedies for the New Year’s holiday? Here’s wishing you and your family a harmless, healthy and happy New Year.
Sincerely,
Jai Lall
